python yield using with recursive method

Apr 16, 2016

let’s start with a simple example:

this example here just return a index generator. this is quiet easy. but one thing you must keep inside: the function has return a generator object, so if you use indexes = list(1, 3, 1) the indexes is a object.

here we step further, we return a list(4, 9, 0.5) in the wrapper, that’s mean: indexes = wrapper(), the indexes will be a generator, not a value.

there comes to the most confusing example:

the example above do not work as expected.

as we have talked about before, the find_element returned a generator object, so when you step into the find_element function, you actually get inside a generator. so when you create a another generator inside it, you need to menually return the element inside the generator back.

the solution above use the idom inside python 3.3, you need to change to for-each structure if you use the python 2.7 version.
